website_summaries.verdict: One of the largest recycling containers available for purchase, this ultra-popular product impresses all around.
pros: Available to purchase in either 50, 65, or 95-gallon weight capacity
Hinged lid stays on when moving
Built-in, heavy-duty wheels allow for smooth portability
Ergonomic handle is comfortable to grip
cons: Prone to cracking in cold temperature

customer_reviews.title: Broken lid hinge
customer_reviews.text: One of the hinges on the lid broke under normal usage. The attached lid was one of the main factors that I considered when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Wallin

customer_reviews.title: Weight limit on plastic lift bar?
customer_reviews.text: Excellent size for family of 4. Need a second to handle holiday trash and birthday parties. Wheels are quiet and smooth. After one year of use, the plastic lip used to hook onto the garbage truck lift has cracked and nearly broken off. I suspect the can will need to be replaced soon as a result. I will probably replace with a can that uses a metal bar rather than plastic. May consider this if your garbage collector uses a lift. If not, then this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: andrew muskovitz

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased three, and two have cracked. I recognize our garbage men are likely hard on it, but isn't that how all garbage men are with all trash cans? Update: the third cracked, too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: Rubbermaid has a 10 year warranty. It says "This recycle bin contains an ultraviolet (UV) stabilizer to help prevent fading and discoloring." It is a outdoor trash bin, yellow faded in 1 year, (warranty not included). I had Ordered on March 21, 2015. The cracks happened , last month, with normal used trash man. The faded and weakened the wall and color the same. I will not buy again. (I had a stroke, aphasia. So, poor writing.)
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A Warning to My Fellow Customers
customer_reviews.text: If you have purchased any of the "Rubbermaid Commercial Brute HDPE 50-Gallon Rollout Trash Cans" you may notice that Amazon says that the "Husky Drum Liners, 55 Gal Clear" is "frequently bought together" with that trash can. For that reason I made that mistake of buying them together. That trash can liner does not fit in that trash can. If you try to stretch it over the top of the trash can, the liner rips. Instead get the "Tall 65 Gallon Black Trash Bags for Toter®, 50 Per Case"
customer_reviews.author: Jay Morrison

customer_reviews.title: There's the story about the Opossum
customer_reviews.text: We bought some value-priced trash cans from (coughWal-coughMart) a local store and the opossums ravaged them like vikings on spring break. This may be due to the fact that my sons are as responsible as sailors on shore leave in Australia, but it, hey, they're young. These roll. They hold a lot of trash, and opossums have yet to crack their DaVinci code. If they do, easily I can add a latch. A digression: Opossum is pronounced "possum". Why did they add the O? I am at a loss. Regardless, a great trashcan, according to my sons.
customer_reviews.author: Maker

customer_reviews.title: The wheels are on an axle that looks like it should have a clamp to hold the axle ...
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are on an axle that looks like it should have a clamp to hold the axle in place. It does not and the whole wheel assembly moves and wobbles badly making the wheels unusable. I made my own clamp but you should not have to fix a major design issue as this!
customer_reviews.author: Gary M

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Used this trash can 3 times before one of the lid hinges broken.
customer_reviews.author: hand ripper

customer_reviews.title: Wheel was off and piece missing
customer_reviews.text: I think the toter looks sturdy and like what we needed, but it arrived with a wheel off of it in the bottom of the box. The cap that locks the wheel into the axle is completely missing. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Shines77

customer_reviews.title: i went to put my garbage in it and when i lifted the lid it ...
customer_reviews.text: for $102 this can is not very durable. came without packaging. it only had a very thin layer of clear wrap around the lid. the top of the lid was dented in. i went to put my garbage in it and when i lifted the lid it was broke. a piece of plastic was missing so the hinge wasnt attached and it fell down. for that kind of money it should be able to take a beating. not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: After a month use already broken!
customer_reviews.text: After a month use already broken ! Not worth the money plus the return deadline is not long enough
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate description
customer_reviews.text: Just got my roll out container. I ordered this unit specifically because the description says it had 8 inch RUBBER wheels. This unit came with plastic wheels. I wanted rubber because my stone drive chews up plastic wheels. The description is bogus.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Miner

customer_reviews.title: Only 54 weeks later it cracked
customer_reviews.text: 54 weeks after receiving this product I came home from work to find it cracked open. I bought this for trash, not recycling, hence we had to paint over the recycling logo as our town has designated recycling containers they provide. I do not know why it was cracked--weather of -10 degrees, a car hit it somehow, the trash collectors threw it? No idea. And now 2 months later the crack just continues to grow and it cannot even be used. I am so disappointed. I thought Rubbermaid was guaranteed for life. It's only for 12 months. Unfortunately this happened 2 weeks too late.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Yates

customer_reviews.title: Great size and durable
customer_reviews.text: No more chasing bottles and plastic bits around the street if it gets windy. No more soggy cardboard bits! And yes I’m rolling this out with ease with snow on the ground !!! YESSSS!!!! If your thinking about buying this please do! Don’t hesitate, I was putting it off because of the price but Lowe’s and Home Depot and other surrounding stores including ace were all the same price. But I got my free shipping with Amazon prime and I didn’t have to haul this around in my car. Great size and durable!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah W

customer_reviews.title: The wheels are too close together so it easily tips over when pulling over the lawn
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are too close together so it easily tips over when pulling over the lawn. It would be perfect on flat surfaces and I am sure it will last forever because it's Rubbermaid. We have Rubbermaid products that are 20 plus years old and we would never consider buying any other brand. It's not as big as the containers I have seen, but the correct measurements were in the description. My error. Rubbermaid is the best; we've learned our lesson the hard way by buying the cheaper brands.
customer_reviews.author: Purchasing Director

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a fan of Rubbermaid quality. This receptacle is strong and durable but the metal bolts that hold the (useless) bar in place underneath the can will NOT screw into the plastic and stay in place. They strip out extremely easy and there's no way to fix it. That one issue alone makes me hate this can. In time when I need a replacement, I'll shop other brands and probably won't buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Darien Wells

customer_reviews.title: I read the reviews, took a chance, and the reviews were right.
customer_reviews.text: As all of the other reviews pointed out they had problems with the quality, I had the same. Wheels wont spin properly and drags on the ground. It will wear out very quickly. It is not easy to use. It's also very cheap quality. I am currently trying to find out if a refund is possible and how to go about returning such a large item. The box it came in was unable to be reused. I will update review on how rubbermaid handles their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Emily L.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, stable, roomy, & jolly
customer_reviews.text: I've nicknamed this thing 'the bumblebee'. I like the hinged lid, as it saves it from being tossed across the grass by the dustmen, the size and dimensions are helpful, with room to spare most weeks, for two people (and a dog) who go through lots of packaging. The stability may seem something to be expected, but not so: when we tried to get a replacement of our existing, boring grey bin, the new one came with absurdly undersized wheels that made the bin tippy even when empty. So that was returned. This bin will be fine in a high wind and is brightening to the eye. Worth paying up a bit more for, compared with other options.
customer_reviews.author: transponder

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are too close together
customer_reviews.text: This is great to have however it is a little difficult to pull with one hand. The wheels at the bottom are pretty close together making it unsteady when pushing or pulling. I have to use both hands to get it stable and I also having recycling to wheel in so I prefer making one trip in stead of two down my long drive way. I have a picture showing the blue recycling garbage that works well with the wheels a little wider. Otherwise I do like this garbage collector.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Medium Weight Recycling Can
customer_reviews.text: This replaced several recycling bins. Now I can use one container, vice several. The wheels and overall construction are for recycling materials (paper, cardboard, plastics, glass, etc.). This can is a medium-duty container that can handle up to 100 lbs. Note: this is not a heavy-duty garbage can. The wheels are light to medium duty at best. I would not recommend it to be picked up by a garbage truck that has to use the plastic cross support to lift it. That should be a steel bar to be considered heavy-duty.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bean

customer_reviews.title: The 50 gallon garbage can is not the size listed
customer_reviews.text: This 50 gallon product's actual dimensions are no where near the dimensions listed on the website. The listed dimensions are 39.58 by 30.08 by 24.00. The actual dimensions are 35.5 by 16 by 16 (all in inches). Clearly a much smaller receptacle. Rubbermaid provided a replacement - but it was the same size. For comparison, the Rubbermaid 65 gallon can is much larger and is listed as 44.74 by 32.33 by 25.33. So it is not a mistake in product. I asked Rubbermaid if they even made a garbage can in the dimensions on the website and never heard back from them. You pays your money and you takes your chances.
customer_reviews.author: Coloradodoc

customer_reviews.title: Easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand took a little getting used to but once I did, it's a nice feature. The can is heavy enough that it doesn't get blown over by the wind. I've never found lying on the ground like another one I have. The wheels are large enough and move freely so carting it down a long driveway is easy, even when it's loaded down with heavy trash. The capacity is good for my family. I've never had evidence of critter problems although I don't know if they've tried but if they have, they've failed.
customer_reviews.author: HS Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Paid 80 bucks for this can because we needed something large with wheels. The first one was delivered with a 8 inch crack so we swapped it out. That process was easy. Got the second can and finally got to use it. It surprisingly doesn’t hold much more than a standard 20 dollar can. Also, this one has already broken one of the latches where it attaches to the can. Not impressed especially for 80 bucks. Usually Rubbermaid is on-point but I would try something different if I did it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty from the Start
customer_reviews.text: This trash can arrived with the end-cap to one of the wheels entirely missing. It came as a surprise the first time I took the can to the curb for pick-up and the wheel fell off. I "solved" the problem by super-gluing a knob to the end so it currently works, but I can't recommend this purchase to anyone. It may have been a fluke that mine came damaged or that the delivery service broke it, but no matter the cause it is a testament to the poor quality of the construction of the can.
customer_reviews.author: S.W. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: The Lid at the bracket broke
customer_reviews.text: It arrived very late. Not a biggie as I dont even know what caused it. However less than a month later the lid is broke. It has a plastic hinge type with screws and it broke on one side. I have seen this in other comments as well
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Ragland

customer_reviews.title: The wheels on the rolling trash can falls off after first use...
customer_reviews.text: Received this on Saturday, rolled it out on Monday night, Tuesday morning, one of the wheels broke off....already? How can this be? One use and now it is history? I found the wheel but not the cap that keeps it attached. I DO NOT recommend this to anyone, Rubbermaid has to do a better job as this is their HEAVY DUTY BRUTE line, this should be more like a WIMPY LINE. Other than the wheel issue, the garbage container looks pretty strong but I need the wheels as I have an extremely long driveway. Maybe I can use this as a rain barrel now....
customer_reviews.author: Telecommie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, large, and mobile.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a nice piece that will hold up over time. It holds three to four large trash bags depending on how full they are. The top doesn't have a fastener or clasp, and is light enough that the wind around here easily blows it open. It could also use a step in the back to make it easier to tilt. I got spoiled with the huge trash bins provided by the trash services everywhere I lived in Illinois, this was the closest I could find at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: rbyteme

customer_reviews.title: Well made, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a replacement can when the old one shattered by our not-so-gently trash company employees, who seem to want to toss the cans as far as possible. This requires a 30 second bit of assembly, to screw in a clip that makes sure the wheel axel remains in place. It's sturdy and light weight, holds a weeks worth of trash for a family of 4. Only 3 stars for durability at this point becaue it's new.
customer_reviews.author: G. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, Huge and Ready!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a rural area and need to make "garbage runs" every two weeks or so. I purchased this bin for our recycling and it has been great! I've been throwing this thing in and out of the back of my pickup for a few weeks now, and it has taken all the abuse I dish out. I use a bungee cord on the lid to ensure it remains closed during transit. Just a note, I was surprised it was shipped USPS, (as was my letter carrier!).
customer_reviews.author: C. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great bin for recyclables, top could use a little work
customer_reviews.text: Unit is great. Warranty was easy for the top. A piece of the top cover that holds it onto the bin was missing / gone. Wheels, bin, handle are all sturdy. Cover is the only lacking piece. Seems you could easily bend it too far and it'd break off the bin or just break completely off if tossed into a garbage truck. However 3 months and its still holding well but isn't used with an automatic garbage team. Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: lesha58

customer_reviews.title: Amazon will make it good.  They have in the past.
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived at my house MISSING ONE WHEEL AND THE WHEEL RETAINER. I wasn't at home when the product arrived or I wouldn't have accepted it. Too much trouble to send it back so I think I will cancel my Amazon membership unless something is done about this problem. I have been a member since 2011 and would hate to quit now but I need satisfaction about this problem. A ONE WHEEL garbage can is of no use to me.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Rosser

customer_reviews.title: Affordable & Mostly Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great trash can for those looking for an affordable rolling can. It's not as big as I thought it would be (my own fault for not really checking measurements), but it's bigger than our old cans and easier to get to the road. My only complaint is that it's extremely unsteady when rolling across the ground when empty. When full, it's fine, but when empty you're basically better off carrying it rather than attempting to roll it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Circelli

customer_reviews.title: NOW let's see how the garbage men self-destruct this one!
customer_reviews.text: Frustrated with life-span of regular 35-40 gallon cans... the Garbage men seem to always destruct them within a month or two... Bottom line... I guess the old saying "You get what you pay for" rings true... starting Thursday and thereon... let's see how long this will last (considering my neighbor still has his and it's over 3+ years old and going strong).. it's worth "putting additional money" upfront!
customer_reviews.author: Steppin' Time

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, terrible support
customer_reviews.text: Showed up with one of the end caps missing. Support website is horrible, no support through amazon, cant find part listed on amazon to just order another. Currently using as is and just dealing with a wheel flying off randomly and having to be put back on every time trashcan is moved. Too much of a pain to return since item is very bulky and I'm never home for UPS pickup. Will NOT buy another Rubbermaid product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve12345

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality. Broken after two uses
customer_reviews.text: Wheel broke- shattered. Unable to use now. I’ve only used it twice for my recycling curbside pickup.i need replacement wheel but can’t find a way to get them. Hoping to get feedback on this review to get a replacement. Certainly a critical failure out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Anjella

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for less than a year and the lid hinge broke. I have to consistently screw back the hinge. Also the trash can was cracked when it tumbled over. I was super disappointed. Now I've just been using a cracked can. I'm going to use it until it completely break down. I really wanted this to last longer with it being advertised as heavy duty!
customer_reviews.author: Kev'n Z

customer_reviews.title: Great for those without recycle service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one of these after moving to a rural area without regular trash/recycling pickup. We now use this for our recycling, and when it’s full we lid it in our truck and take it to the recycling plant about a mile away. It’s not as durable as the “Waste Industries” trash bin we used to have (this had a thinner plastic material, and lid feels a little flimsy), but it definitely works for our purposes!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made & Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived right away & Adore it! Needed something that would roll down my driveway, fit in my tight fitting garage & wouldn’t blow down the street on a windy day nor loose the lid. It’s perfect for this as the lid is attached! Great weight & very sturdy construction. Exactly the quality & toughness I would expect from Rubbermaid.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Rubbermaid Quality
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Rubbermaid Commercial Trash Can in February 2019 and this November one of the hinges snapped off. We purchased this to replace our trash can (not Rubbermaid) that we has used for years because it finally wore out. The can worked well for us for about 9 months and then one of the hinges snapped off. Needless to say I was disappointed in the quality of a Rubbermaid product and won't be purchasing another trash can from them.
customer_reviews.author: CLC

customer_reviews.title: Hinge for top broke within 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: I love that they appear to be sturdy. The wheels are nice, they even lock. However, I guess our garbage men are extra rough because the hinges to the covers were broken in no time. I am very disappointed especially at this price! I would expect these to last at least a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Deen

customer_reviews.title: Ok but scratched
customer_reviews.text: Well, my Rubbermaid Brute arrived as a standalone product, meaning there was no box, it was just delivered as is. There were scratches on the top which I have shown you with photos. This doesn’t interfere with the use of the product, I was just disappointed that it was scratched. It is heavy duty, so product is as described.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Joerres

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Quality and Perfect timing!
customer_reviews.text: I so appreciate both the quality and the delivery of my Rollout Heavy-Duty Wheeled Recycling Can. It came just as advertised - great sturdiness, durability, and appeal! The delivery person was very courteous and helpful in ensuring that it was properly assembled and that it was placed exactly where I wanted it. I would definitely do business with these folks again - kudos!!
customer_reviews.author: kevin m. deans sr

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to order this product, since I was worried about how I would wrestle such a large item out of the shipping box. However, the cart arrived unboxed in great condition, with the lid secured with easy to remove heavy duty tape. The shipping label was placed on the lid. The cart had no scratches or damage, and was ready to use immediately. Perfect! The cart is well-made, lightweight, easy to roll about, and has more than ample capacity, while keeping outdoor critters from accessing the contents. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M. Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: you need this. Sanity purchase
customer_reviews.text: you have to have this size if you have a family and don't want animals in your trash. Dont have that problem anymore! I got 2 of them for a family of 4. Best purchase ..only gave 4 stars for the durability because one of the caps popped off of the wheel and the wheel keeps popping off. They should really cover them caps for the price. Also made a cardboard castle for the kids out of the 4 boxes I got with it.
customer_reviews.author: Riss

customer_reviews.title: Recycle Can with Attached Lid and Wheels is Very Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and size of the can. The attached lid is a convenience for me. The wheels are light weight. I'll probably have more sturdy wheels put on the can at a later time. I have owned this can for more than two months and it seems to be holding up very well. I would recommend to others and plan to buy another one for a rental home. It's a great product for keeping things neat until the recycle is picked up.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: You simply cannot go wrong with Rubbermaid products from indoor kitchen products to outdoor for their durability. I bought this can two weeks ago because our township does not allow the use of the Glad clear blue recycle tie bags anymore. The recycle bags are 30 gallons in size and this recycle bin can easily hold two bags worth with a few inches to spare. So, if your township is switching over to no bags allowed, I recommend this product for your next purchase if your township does not supply recycle bins for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: This solidly built trash can will improve your life
customer_reviews.text: This oversized garbage can makes getting your trash to the curb a breeze. It replaces 2 smaller cans that weren't holding up. It is such a pleasure to have a single, rock solid garbage can that holds almost three times what a normal can will. Pushing it to the curb is very easy and smooth. And it's too big for our sociopathic garbage man to turn over and spill garbage in our driveway and damage our can. That alone made this purchase well worth it because I don't have to pick up trash blowing around in my driveway anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Deal Hunter

customer_reviews.title: A large, sturdy container
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, very heavy duty trash can. My only caveat is that it is quite heavy. While it wheels fine over level, paved ground, assess whether you are strong enough to move it if you have a slanted or soft area over which you plan to move it. I cannot comment yet on how well it will last in my mid-Atlantic climate, but a similar container has stood up well over the four years I have had it.
customer_reviews.author: bigfooted

customer_reviews.title: Ligh-duty trash can
customer_reviews.text: The material is very thin including the wheels. Surprised to see Rubbermaid has guts to calls this one as a "Commercial". There are no reinforce metal bars like my old one (made by Toter). The lid is deformed during the shipping (excessive heat, or cheap material?) which caused a big gap between the lid and the can. I really doubt it can hold something heavy, and neither it would last long. Too much hassles to return it, and to buy a new one. Shopped in HD and Lowes, seems all trash cans sold are just like this. No way you can use a word "Sturdy" to describe them. Bear with it, and to see.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: We loved ours...  Until the garbage truck ate it
customer_reviews.text: For the price this can is really sturdy, rolls great, had ideal capacity and very durable. Our garbage service uses those robo grip arms that come from the side of the truck and lift the cans to dump them in the top. Well ours must have slipped and fell into the truck. So it worked great until it was gone. Would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: PRA7 Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Rubbermaid Quality makes the difference
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for non commercial use as our previous products were clunky and fell apart quickly. The quality is quite apparent. Maneuverability and durability are high. When you get a thumbs up from the trash guys that you bought the right replacement...that says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Kingsley

customer_reviews.title: Came unboxed!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchase of this trash can. I loved my first! This one came unboxed, as is. The wheels at the bottom were broken and a metal piece that was needed to attach the wheels was missing. Very unhappy. Sent it back and ordered another. Fingers crossed that was just a fluke. Stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Awkward and unmanageable, wheels are too small
customer_reviews.text: This is the MOST unmanageable garbage can I have ever used. In attempting to take my garbage out to the front of the house this can was totally awkward, flopped over and I had to rebundle everything that fell out onto the street. The wheels on this are way too small for the size of the container, making it very hard to move. It is totally unstable, to move it anywhere the wheels are useless, you have to drag it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Necessary For Anyone Who Recycles A Lot
customer_reviews.text: Large Recycling Bin for us was a MUST. And this one is perfect. Lovely blue color with the recycling symbol, quality wheels and shape. It has served us very well. So glad we bought it, and I recommend to anyone who collects a lot of recycling to purchase this one. It is worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Would not even consider another one
customer_reviews.text: The town I live in provides us with a recycling garbage bin, but not the regular garbage bin. The ones that are sold at Ace Hardware are of poor quality and very expensive. I found this Brute on Amazon and I've had it for almost a year and it is not broken or disappointed. The wheels are fine, the lid is fine there are no cracks and it easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kratochvil

customer_reviews.title: There's no limit to my cheapness
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because it was $20 cheaper than the regular one without the recycling symbol. It's a durable trash can with wheels that can be picked up by automated arms if that's a requirement. I actually found blue paint that matches this perfectly and covered up the recycling symbol just so there was no confusion. Do I feel cheap? yes. But why the heck does this cost more than the same trash can without the logo?
customer_reviews.author: Buyer of things

customer_reviews.title: Looking for info on a container Rollout,65G,GY
customer_reviews.text: The garbage can is great. But I have a concern there is a bar on the bottom of the can that moves forward and backward When moving the can. This bar I do not know what is the purpose for it. Maybe if the garbage man uses it when putting it in the truck. The bar on the bottom interferes when pushing and pulIing. If anyone knows more info please answer. Problem solved. It is a way to snap it in.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Lid hinges break easily- wheelbase is too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the look of this can because it resembled our recycling bin. Same size and weight. The can is built well, but not well enough to withstand the conditions of the garbage workers. The hinge broke easily because it’s only screwed in using screws but I was able to through bolt it. Hopefully it holds. My only other beef is the wheelbase is to narrow. The can easily tips over when you’re pulling it on a rough surface.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B

customer_reviews.title: Yellow garbage can
customer_reviews.text: I love it because no one has yellow in my neighborhood so is unique and mine and it stands out in the night so now no excuse for them to skip my house like other times where they left my garbage saying they didn’t see it. Yellow is bright they can’t miss it. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: CARMEN CORTES

customer_reviews.title: Emphasis on the word COMMERCIAL
customer_reviews.text: This is principally designed for those situation where the garbage truck is capable of hooking onto the bar on the front of the pail. It is too big, heavy and cumbersome for a garbage man in NYC to lift up and dump into the back of the truck. They will reach in and pull out recycle items that are bagged but any loose items will stay there. Cannot fault the pail, it just is not appropriate for a residence.
customer_reviews.author: Pat & Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, great quality, great service
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the bin. While its not a heavy duty bin like some that you may receive from your town, it is more than good enough. Wheels are sturdy, lid has no issues and the overall build is great. If you manhandle it, yes, you may run into some issues, but thats like anything. In other regards, I did have an issue with the delivery, but the owner contacted me personally and resolved the issue. It was nice to sees someone who values customer service and wants to keep their buyers coming back. Highly recommend on all fronts.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Gangemi

customer_reviews.title: Best trash can you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these and it is Great. I like the way you can hook a 55 gallon trash bag to the rim of the can and put grass and shrub cuttings easily into it. Then pull the bag out and put on the street. Ready for the next bag. My old one is several years old, but the lid wore out. I still use it for Yard work.
customer_reviews.author: GAP

customer_reviews.title: Can't find can liners to fit unit that are cost effective.
customer_reviews.text: I love the unit itself! Add says it is 50-gal container. The 55-gal liners I'm using with my old unit want fit this unit. I use Berkley Jensen industrial drum liners (clear 1.2-mil thick 50-bags to box) for under $14.00-box. All suggested bags are $30 to $70 for 10 to 30 bags.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D. Alsabrook, Sr

customer_reviews.title: Great Company & Arrived in Perfect Condition.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The assemble was east. The delivery was perfect--no cumbersome box in which to contain the trash can. It was taped shut, and was its own packaging. Ingenious. And not a scratch on it. It arrived in perfect condition, and it arrived, quickly. I ordered for my kitchen trash, as we do not eat out and have a lot of trash. It goes great with our kitchen. Beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: This is just like what the City of Chicago issues all their residents. My parents don't live in chicago, however, and have to supply their own pails. They have to drag the pails back and forth once a week and as a result, the bottoms of their cans have worn out. This pail is perfect. Absolutely perfect. Sturdy, wheeled so no more dragging (and erosion), this thing is HUGE. What used to take my parents 3 small, cheapo pails now only requires one of these big boys. My mom took a sharpie and wrote their address on the side. It stands out nicely against the yellow. The lid is attached, so now it's not getting lost.
customer_reviews.author: miyazawagirl

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not durable
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice trashcan, but not very durable. The front grab is plastic and didn't take but a year before it started to crack. It is now about two years old and is cracked so badly it will need replaced. At the price paid more than two years would have been nice. I gave it one star per year it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan L.

customer_reviews.title: Broken from the jump
customer_reviews.text: When I received this recycling trash can I thought it would be super strong and reliable but I was wrong. I just received this yesterday and put it in my garage today and what’s the first thing I see.. the prong holding the lid is broken for the price I paid for this.. it sucks ..
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, thin, and smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: Fingers crossed it hold up. Nothing like the quality trash can you get from your garbage company. Plasticbis thin, hollow, and already can see light through all the seems and it was just delivered today. Like many of the reviews below, it is cheaply made. Also, it is much smaller than a standard garbage truck can.
customer_reviews.author: Master Sergeant

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to buy a second.
customer_reviews.text: Got these (bought a 2nd) at HALF the price of what my membership store wants for them... Keep the dirty little critters out of our trash!!! Haven't opened a lid yet! *crosses fingers, knocks on wood, tosses salt in all directions as GF screams at me and asks wth I'm doing and where I went as she can't see now* (c;
customer_reviews.author: MrMega

customer_reviews.title: Something doesn’t feel right here
customer_reviews.text: I thought I bought a standard size rolling garbage can. 50 gallons and sent it to my sons home away, but he tells me it is small. It cost 117.00 with shipping Thts a bit expensive for what he is telling me arrived. I’m thinking I got taken. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene B. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Not mobile without wheels SO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I have a large amount of weekly recycle so I thought I’d have a storage and in wheels so easy to get out however the can arrived with NO WHEELS. I’ve emailed Rubbermaid but no clue when to expect a answer due to the virus hopefully I can get a set of wheels otherwise it’s useless. Update. Took 3 months to get the wheels. They sent only the wheels nothing needed to attach them. DO NO PURCHASE
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Makes me look forward to taking the trash out (well, almost)
customer_reviews.text: I never thought there would be anything compelling about a trash can, but what do I know. These Rubbermaid commercial cans are amazing; they hold a reasonable volume (anything bigger would be unmanageable for my wife) and are very easy to maneuver with their large wheels. They are very durable made from a flexible material that easily handles the inevitable beating from our trash collectors. And they are easy to wash out; crude washes off the smooth interior surface easily with a garden hose (our other trash cans seem to provide the perfect surface for things to cling to).
customer_reviews.author: tommyr

customer_reviews.title: Flawed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Rubbermaid that had its lid broken where it attaches to the bottom. The wind blew the container over and when I set it back up I noticed the break. I thought that this model would be designed more sturdier but I notice that the connection of the lid to the container is the same as the one that broke. When this breaks I will switch to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: This was the right price, but clearly with lowered price comes some trad offs...
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time finding a trash bin to put at the curb for the city trucks to pick up that didn't cost a small fortune. This was the right price, but clearly with lowered price comes some trad offs: the bin easily tips over if I roll over a rock or uneven pavement; unfortunately it does NOT seal shut or snap tightly closed so racoons get in it...every. single. night. until we secured in an enclosure (bungee cords didn't work).
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT..
customer_reviews.text: We have single family home amount recyclables in a townhouse. Our receptacle HARDLY contains our weekly output! Ordered this hefty guy! PERFECT....for 2 weeks. One of the wheels came off. So, it's currently leaning on the wall in the garage taking up precious space. D I S A P P O I N T E D with its lack of durability! ESPECIALLY from Rubbermaid! Otherwise, it would've gotten 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dislike
customer_reviews.text: I bought what I thought would be large enough and it’s not, very small inside and it has a metal thing in the back between wheels that makes it hard to maneuver. I do not like this and would not order again. Would love to send it back but it may be more trouble than it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Hands full,no problem
customer_reviews.text: In our fellowship hall at church we had a Rubbermaid Brute with a flat lid. It was inconvenient to hold a cup in one hand open the lid and dispose of a plate with the other hand. The step open can had solved that problem. We have not had it long enough to evaluate the Durability. I hope it gives us years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Campbell

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Too Small
customer_reviews.text: Too soon to really tell, but the bin seems to be high quality and durable- not flimsy plastic. My only complaint is the size, I wish it were a bit bigger. My large size kitchen trash bags are a bit too snug going into the bin and it doesn’t hold more two or three bags. If you have a large family, I’d suggest going for a bin that is a bit larger!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: A perfect recycle bin for two people for a two week pick-up schedule.
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a wagon and empty cat litter containers for recycling when we separated the different items. We aren't asked to separate items anymore, and just put it all together. This has been perfect for that. It is sturdy and a good size for two people. If you have more people, you may need two. We fill it every two weeks. When we put it out for pick up we use a bungie(sp) cord to prevent the lid (it is pretty light) from blowing open. We attach the hook on the cord at the back hinge going over the lid to the front handle and it works perfectly. My mom saw ours and ordered one for herself.
customer_reviews.author: A Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great. Does the trick. About $32 more than it should have been.
customer_reviews.text: For $67, I’d expect something a little stronger from Rubbermaid. A smaller version just a tiny bit flimsier was at Walmart for $19.
customer_reviews.author: Southgal

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money! Garbage. Pun intended!
customer_reviews.text: Literally the biggest waste of money ever! The bottom wheel base drags on the ground. It causes it to tip over. You can’t roll it. It is just heavy and unable to be maneuvered at all.
customer_reviews.author: M Chaput

customer_reviews.title: My Helper
customer_reviews.text: This garbage can is great for me for recycling. I am not a person that recycles and I know I should because this will save the environment. So now with this can I have been recycling. It makes it so easy for me and its large enough to collect a lot of recycling items. I had a garbage shed built and I'm happy with this item. Now when I have company and parties I have a large enough pail that I can recycle like I'm suppose to and do my part to save the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Praiser

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how bad my old trash bin was until I rolled this one out... Wow, having big, solid wheels really makes a difference! I'm not looking forward to snow, but I know this is going to be a lot easier to drag out when it does snow. Beyond that, what can you say about a trash bin? It holds a lot, it's clean and neat, and is definitely value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Moira Allen

customer_reviews.title: Lid torn off by wind - hasn't held up at all - NOT WORTH THE PRICE.
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy again. It has not weathered well. The lid was torn off by the wind, container plastic pieces chipping away. I wouldn't advise this manufacturer. I thought paying significantly more would provide a long-lasting product.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne A. Kretz

customer_reviews.title: It is a recycling bin
customer_reviews.text: In an effort to see just what I can order from Amazon, and after I realized my trash company charged a fortune for recycling bins, I ordered this one. I am a little disappointed by the size, but that was my fault. I was expecting a mush larger bin. However, my kids were incredibly excited to see the huge cardboard box that it came in! The cardboard box was more than enough reason to order this trash bin, and the fact that it was $20 cheaper than the trash co wanted only makes it a better deal!
customer_reviews.author: Ld

customer_reviews.title: Took a long time to deliver
customer_reviews.text: Large capacity and strong plastic that is durable enough and should last thru a hot summer. The only drawback is shipping. It took weeks to arrive and then had to be scheduled so someone could sign for it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Simmons

customer_reviews.title: For I can tell so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a used like new item came well packaged doesn't seem to be defective in any way I'll let you know how well it holds up to the garbage men and weather,etc and update my review in about 3 to 6 months,from 04,15,20
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Looks like this one will last! The garbage men or their mechanical lift broke my previous 2. They were from local home stores with barely attached lids, not this level of sturdiness. So when we were issued recycling bins I tried to get similar. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: designdiva

customer_reviews.title: It will not survive the trash collection truck
customer_reviews.text: The first time I put this at the curb, it was mangled and completely destroyed. Apparently the trash truck tried to lift it. When I went to return the container to the garage, one of the wheels was broken off, the lid was mangled and the container itself was bent and crushed. I was out almost $100.00 on one day. By all rights it should be returned but I wouldn't know how to do that. Guess I could send all the parts in several boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus O'Leary

customer_reviews.title: easy to move around without breaking any backs or cracking ...
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of replacing cheaper cans. We need ones that have the wheels and the large handle areas. While we don't Need one that the lid is on with a hinge, this is a big plus. No more chasing lids down the street after the trashmen throw it from the trucks. I would give it a 5+, but honestly, the price is at least $10 too high in my opinion. Otherwise, this Rubbermaid is heavy duty as stated, but because of how it is designed, easy to move around without breaking any backs or cracking any knees.
customer_reviews.author: SaraShopper

customer_reviews.title: Apparently tastes good to squirrels.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the wheels broke on my old one. I figured a commercial grade Rubbermaid brute would be a good decision. It worked to put trash in and rolled, but squirrels ate through it in about 3 days. I would not recommend this. How can squirrels chew threw a commercial grade trash container in less than a week?
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: A wimpy sort of Brute.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it because it looked like the cans my city provides for a hefty rental fee. When I received it I was dismayed to find it is not heavy duty but is a much lighter weight and does not roll well when empty. The lid is warped but does close tight. The worst part is it is only 4 months old and the handle/hinge has broke thru. I expected better for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This garbage can lasted less than 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The wheels kept falling off - then they finally just broke completely. Now the garbage can falls over and dumps trash out if we take it to the street. But I paid so much for it I can't see throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Bishop

customer_reviews.title: if these do not fit or work you are out of luck returning
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful cans and well made. However we found out living in the Florida primitive land of zero recycling we were told that Waste Management would only pick up recycling in these small basket sized open containers. While it was our fault for not asking Waste Management first knowing where we live I was shocked they refused to pick up anything in these containers. However, Amazon refused to allow us to return two unused and still sealed containers (2 orders) without us paying for the $45 per container to return. So be darn sure you can keep them as the return policy is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Merkl

customer_reviews.title: it only came with one wheel
customer_reviews.text: I just received this rubber maid product about 10 min ago today from UPS. There's a problem it only came with one wheel. The lid was taped closed and when I opened it only had the bolt to hold the wheel on was in there. When can I expect to receive the other wheel.
customer_reviews.author: michael b

customer_reviews.title: Broken lid hinge and written on in marker
customer_reviews.text: I have four of these. The last one came with a broken lid hinge and was written on with marker. Very disappointed. I called the company and they refused to do anything other than have me find a way to return it. So now I have three that are amazing and one that started out with a broken hinge. For this kind of money it should not come broken. Not cool
customer_reviews.author: patricio m

customer_reviews.title: Great dependable can
customer_reviews.text: As we always stress do your due diligence, Lowe's was the same price for one (1) as two (2) were on Prime ***BUT*** If you buy the two pack here the cost was more then if you bought them separately! SO buy them separately. It is up to you to due your due diligence!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Balogh

customer_reviews.title: Rubbermaid,well done.
customer_reviews.text: This Rubbermaid trash bin with wheels is great. i like everything about it. the wheels are much better made than most and the bin rolls very easily with little effort. Well done Rubbermaid, only I don't know why the other colors cost more than blue. I believe a trash can doesn't need to be color coordinated or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: kodiak

customer_reviews.title: Not for a hundred bucks you don't...
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality I hoped for at all, I figured because of the price the trash can would be a heavy duty can. But it's not, in fact the trash kept falling over every time I opened it because the lid weighs more than the entire can. Hard pass
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Durable recycling bin with a quality look
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger/outdoor solution for my volume of recycling that could handle more than the blue bin the city recycling provides. The bin is exactly as pictured and so far has held up well to the outside environments of snow, sun, rain, and heavy winds. Granted I've got this sitting up against a building and partially covered by a soffit. I docked one star because the wheel on the other side keeps coming off since it was missing a metal plug that holds the wheel assembly together.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Shah

product_meta.title: Rubbermaid Commercial Products Fg9W2773Blue Brute Rollout Heavy-Duty Wheeled Recycling Can/Bin, 50-Gallon, Blue Recycling
product_meta.description: Color:Blue Recycling| Size:50G| Style:StandardThe Rubbermaid Commercial Brute Rollout Trash/Recycling Can with Hinged Lid is the industry leader in waste and material handling applications. These seamless rectangular recycle bins are constructed of durable polyethylene with a hinged lid, integrated handle, inset wheels and are imprinted with the universal recycling symbol for increased waste management compliance. Heavy-duty polyethylene weighs less than aluminum or steel and resists cracking. The hinged lid open fully and locks against the trash/recycling bins. A molded-in axle retainer adds strength while inset wheels make the recycle bin maneuverable and help prevent damage to walls and doorways. A molded-in catch bar makes the trash/recycle bins compatible with automated and semi-automated lift systems for curbside garbage and recycling collection. This trash/recycle bin contains an ultraviolet (UV) stabilizer to help prevent fading and discoloring.
feature_bullets: Effortless movement easy mobility for material handling, general refuse, and bulk waste collection in commercial locations, homes, garages, and driveways
Durable wheels heavy duty wheels with high performance treads are optimized for use indoors and outdoors
Strong construction reinforced rim for superior structural integrity and robust lid designed for added strength
Full range lid rollout lids open fully and stay in place to prevent swinging during transport
Autolifter ready compliant with ansi standard z245.60 (types b and g) for compatibility with auto-lifters
Seamless construction smooth contours and seamless construction make cleaning easier and quicker, to improve staff productivity
Ideal ergonomics designed with an ergonomic handle for comfortable push or pull operation
Long lasting high quality materials plus a uv inhibitor extend the life of the container
Extreme temperatures: Designed to maintain performance at freezing temperatures as low as 0° f
Dimensions 29 inches x 24 inches x 36 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
